TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Progress is Progressing Progressively" Edition

Articles.Content: I am still convinced the unmodded feature they're implementing is Solid rocks. The assets being made by the art team I'm convinced is cities.

I think that's a good guess Gregrox. Max is fond of little revealing puns. It's 90% percent of the framework for the big feature that's coming later. Making a rock solid could make the planet more interesting, but "if you play well, you won't run into it."

I think that's a good guess Gregrox. Max is fond of little revealing puns. It's 90% percent of the framework for the big feature that's coming later. Making a rock solid could make the planet more interesting, but "if you play well, you won't run into it."

... that would be one of the awesomest but not revealing puns EVER in the HISTORY OF SECRETS if it is true. Cities and solid rocks is a guess I had when first hearing about the new asset project. Also there has been talk of surface effects in the distant past in random development related posts so it could be a continuation of that. Things have a tendency to go quiet when approaching their final goal... I still don't know how much real possibility there is to this happening soon. If cities are being added, I want a CITY EDITOR!
They haven't even touched the astronaut/employee management systems yet. They're not putting their whole art staff on giant cosmetic fancies like cities. It's not gonna be cities.

What about something a little less ambitious than Kerbin wide cities, construction at the KSC

Facilities start far more basic, and require upgrading and/or extension during progress through the campaign (like the tech tree, except buildings)

You can have VAB size limiting rocket size, advanced research requiring you to upgrade your facilities, spotting asteroids requires building a telescope for the R&D complex etc etc

With the extension that Facilities can be damaged and need to be repaired

Facilities start far more basic, and require upgrading and/or extension during progress through the campaign (like the tech tree, except buildings)

That is a very plausible idea... and one I would love to see. ALSO though, having engines and parts start far more basic, and requiring upgrades is something I wish was stock too.

I thought I remember seeing in the past something about a discovery mechanic eventually being put in to see/discover the other planets, so you start off only knowing of Kerbin, Kerbol, the Mun and maybe Minmus, which would require some sort of telescope.

That is a very plausible idea... and one I would love to see. ALSO though, having engines and parts start far more basic, and requiring upgrades is something I wish was stock too.

This is also my jam

I would really love to be able to do this with KOSMOS, so you could unlock (for example) a basic 1960's level RD-253 and then upgrade it during the techTree to (eventually) the RD-275K, without have all the obsoleted parts still showing up in the VAB.

There was this really cool one that allowed you to duplicate Kerbals.

...Asexual Kerbals reproducing in space? you promised us there were females. Also, that just reminds me of the Russian experiment to see if lizards would reproduce in space...Kerbals are green, so are lizards, therefore Kerbals are lizards?...experiment results logged +1000 science points

There was this really cool one that allowed you to duplicate Kerbals. Basically, when you transferred a Kerbal, put it out on EVA, then got it back on the ship, it was duped. It was a fun little bug, it was still a bug and need to be squashed, sorry.

The possible fun thing is that I had exactly that bug with CrewXfer (so I had two(!) Jebs for a while )
